column4: norty; possibly change the port in your windows(school box) to port 2222 and forward 2222 to 22 in your router.
norty; that would get around the blockage if your school is blocking port 22.. which i would think they are.
norty; what type of router do you have?
most schools forward www through a proxy (and dansdguardian) and block everything else..
I saw once a technique to tunnel IP through DNS requests .. not very efficient, but very good at getting around firewalls :)
my wife is used to ubuntu now and hates windows (and she hasn't even seen vista yet :)
both ends are behind NAT and he doesn't know how to forward ports...
not at all, they can just use winscp from the windows end, drag and drop the file..
only one end needs to figure out port forwarding
just that ftp is more complex than scp.. passive vs active mode, etc..
not so simple ... it's a notification icon
you sure? I ran compiz on a mx440
odd, I had a mx440 in a 1.1ghz box and it was quite acceptable.. not perfect but pretty smooth considering.
probably.. I had a simple 1024x768 desktop, played videos, didn't ever try to play two together and spin the cube around or anything.. but for just basic desktop use the effects worked pretty well
possibly, as long as neither wants to link part of the other in some way
